contentrichtext.text: The '''Dix River''' is a {{convert|79.3|mi|km|adj=mid|-long}}<ref name=NHD>U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. [http://viewer.nationalmap.gov/viewer/ The National Map], accessed June 13, 2011</ref> tributary of the [[Kentucky River]] in central [[Kentucky]] in the [[United States]]. It begins in western [[Rockcastle County, Kentucky|Rockcastle County]], about {{convert|5|mi|km|0}} west of [[Mount Vernon, Kentucky|Mount Vernon]]. It flows generally northwest, in a tight [[meander]]ing course, passing north of [[Stanford, Kentucky|Stanford]] and east of [[Danville, Kentucky|Danville]]. Northwest of Danville it is impounded by the [[Dix Dam]] to form the [[Herrington Lake]] reservoir. The river then flows about {{convert|2|mi|km|0}} before joining the Kentucky River near [[High Bridge, Kentucky|High Bridge]], about {{convert|20|mi|km}} southwest of [[Lexington, Kentucky|Lexington]], in the region of the [[Kentucky River Palisades]]. The watershed of the river is largely [[agriculture|agricultural land]], with undulating hills over a bed of [[limestone]]. The river is a popular destination for [[fly fishing]], in particular for varieties of [[bass (fish)|bass]]. Occasionally, recreational kayakers and canoeists can be found on tame day trips. Water levels are Class I+ with possible mild class II. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.uky.edu/WaterResources/Watershed/KRB_AR/dix_river_(lower).htm University of Kentucky: lower Dix River watershed] *[http://www.uky.edu/WaterResources/Watershed/KRB_AR/dix_river_(upper).htm University of Kentucky: upper Dix River watershed] *{{GNIS|517054|Dix River}} {{coord|37|48|53|N|84|42|59|W|display=title}} [[Category:Rivers of Kentucky]] [[Category:Geography of Rockcastle County, Kentucky]] [[Category:Geography of Lincoln County, Kentucky]] [[Category:Geography of Boyle County, Kentucky]] [[Category:Geography of Garrard County, Kentucky]]
